comments.body:
@kwilcox the patch for the `ctypes.util.find_library` in conda is usually this.  We hardcode the conda c-lib path. that will break the package for any other c-lib, but ensures it always works with the one declared in the recipe dependencies.

This seems to work.  There are a few failures due to some dependencies that did not land on the channel yet.  I will finish this tomorrow.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +63,67 @@+    elif platform == 'Darwin':
+        libname = 'libgeos_c.dylib'
+    lgeos = CDLL(os.path.join(sys.prefix, 'lib', libname))
+elif os.name == 'nt':
+    # On Windows, the GDAL binaries have some OSR routines exported with
